criteria: Applying Power Series Differentiation and Integration
Forming New Series from Known Ones
descriptions: The student does not demonstrate an understanding of how to differentiate or integrate power series.
The student attempts to differentiate or integrate a power series but makes significant errors in the process.
The student differentiates or integrates a simple power series but struggles with more complex examples.
The student can differentiate and integrate most power series correctly but may have minor errors in some cases.
The student demonstrates a strong ability to differentiate and integrate power series accurately.
The student expertly differentiates and integrates power series, demonstrating a deep understanding of the underlying concepts and can apply this to novel situations.
The student does not demonstrate an ability to form new series from known ones through differentiation or integration.
The student attempts to form new series but does so incorrectly or without a clear strategy.
The student can form new series from simple known series but struggles with more complex transformations.
The student can form new series from known ones in most cases, but may make mistakes with more complex manipulations.
The student accurately forms new series from known ones, demonstrating a solid understanding of the processes involved.
The student skillfully forms new series from known ones, demonstrating a deep understanding of series manipulation and can explain the limitations of the new series' radius of convergence.
The student does not understand the convergence properties of the new series formed through differentiation or integration.
The student attempts to analyze convergence but is unable to do so correctly.
The student can determine convergence for simple cases but struggles with more complex series.
The student generally understands convergence properties but may make mistakes in determining the interval of convergence.
The student accurately determines the convergence of the new series and the limitations of the new radius of convergence.

The student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the convergence of the new series including the limitations of the radius of convergence and how differentiation or integration effects that radius of convergence.
